intro: Matelea demuneri, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom at night. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested. Its flowers have a strong, sweet scent that attracts nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
